Key Match Events: Canada won by 12 runs against Ireland.
Shreyas Movva scored 37 runs off 36 balls with 3 fours.
Nicholas Kirton scored 49 runs off 35 balls with 3 fours and 2 sixes.
Harry Tector was run out off the last ball of the over.
Mark Adair was caught at long-on by Lorcan Tucker.
Dilon Heyliger was caught at long-on by Barry McCarthy.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada and Ireland will face off in the T20 World Cup 2024 in New York.
Ireland wins the toss and elects to bowl.
For Canada, off-spinner Nikhil Dutta goes out and leg-spin all-rounder Junaid Siddiqui comes in.
For Ireland, leg-spinner Ben White sits out and a seamer comes in.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada registered its first-ever T20 World Cup win when it beat Ireland by 12 runs in its Group A match of the 2024 edition.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
Ireland struggled to score, needing 17 runs off the last over.
Canada's innings saw a 50-run partnership between Shreyas Movva and Nicholas Kirton.
